recordings.loc: Bushey Norwood, Bath, Bath and North East Somerset, England
recordings.rmk:
A recording of drumming which is not commonly heard. There is also some tapping at 0:19.

I heard the bird drum on an old tree and I started recording. 
As I looked into the tree I saw a green woodpecker low down in the crown. However, when the drumming sounded again (1:30) I could see that it was not this bird drumming. Another green woodpecker came and sat in the top of the tree and the lower one flew off (1:59). 
I think the upper one flew off too. At 2:16 I heard the bird perform the more typical "yaffle" which surprised me as at this stage I could not see any green woodpeckers. I took a few steps forward and stopped the recording. The green woodpecker that had drummed and called flew out of a nest hole in the tree and flew to some others nearby!
The bird then performed a number of yaffles which I captured in recording XC553921. 

As I understand it, the drumming is performed, not as a territorial song (as is the case with Greater Spotted Woodpeckers which drum often), but is given when the male and female are present at the nest. I am unsure whether the presence of a third bird had any bearing on the bird drumming.

Recorded with an Olympus LS-12 and Sennheiser ME66 handheld. Edited below 300 Hz to remove wind noise.

recordings.rmk: Same bird as XC 128692. Calls of an excited bird flying to one of its favourite perches on forest edge bordering extensive farmed vineyards. The calling bird was active all the time flying up and down the forest edge in search  of also very vocal and active neighbour. One of the first warm and sunny days in spring. Equipment: Telinga Pro 7 Stereo Dat Mic, Sound Devices 702

Song from top strata of forest edge to extensively farmed vineyards on one of the first warm and sunny days in spring. On the borderline of two Territories. The calling bird was active all the time flying up and down the forest edge in search of the also very vocal and active neighbour. Equipment: Telinga Pro 7 Stereo Dat Mic, Sound Devices 702
fledged young
In mixed forest in snowing weather.
Bird managed to keep out of sight but I assume it was a newly fledged young near the nest. Very likely associated with the birds of XC103160, some eighty meters away.  [52.126, 4.341]
Alarm caused  by a sitting Common Buzzard. Probably an adult female GW with one or two (quiet) fledgelings. [52.125, 4.340]

Bird well seen drumming. According to Ulf Elmann and Erik Rosenberg, author of "Fåglar i Sverige" this is a "once in a lifetime" behaviour in other places. Here in France, we are lucky to witness this rare behaviour on a daily basis. Also see the 18 other recordings from that day.

**bird is loud**  --  **at a little heath with trees and bushes**  ...recorded with a cheap chinese audio-spystick, that was fastened there, at a chain-link fence of a afforest area, ....20 cm above ground    ... "...so at this place **are quite loud to hear various grasshoppers** : ...mainly e.g.:  upland green grasshopper [Tettigonia cantans]    -- & : meadow grasshopper [Pseudochorthippus parallelus, syn.: Chorthippus parallelus]  
   

 .. **-sound was trapped-  .. for 3 days  --Wednesday 18.07. - Saturday 21.07.2018 --**

place: (( KUSApoleWOIDsanktuAT037 )) .  -....(( SANKTU-Hege!! ))

date/time  **now:  >   ... {{starts at Wednesday 18.07.2018 at late evening}} ...till noon Thursday 19.07.2018** 

**the analyze of these birds, so isn't shure...cause all NOT SEEN !**

**here:**   

background noise can be some times: traffic noise & plane & rodent & rattl of the fence .

... [all birds of this timer-session  ---heath 07.2018---  see here](https://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%20uhl%20loc%3A%20bobingen%20year%3A%202018%20rmk%3A%20KUSApoleWOIDsanktuAT037) .

... hearing the sound:  .... **regulate volume not too loud**

....  [... plus my former recordings at this place - heath -are here](https://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%20uhl%20loc%3A%20bobingen%20rmk%3A%20SANKTU-Hege) .

Editing: High-pass filter, cutoff frequency 1kHz, some amplification.

Equipment: Olympus WS-822 digital recorder with Audio-technica ATR 6550 shotgun.

in mixed forest - **sound was trapped [NO!! bird seen!]** for 3 1/2 days (07.11.-10.11.2017) ...24 hours each day. ...habi:'bukWEnort-hab5'  ....i recorded with the Chinese " voice-recorder 'd 50' "; sorry, it has no 'zoom-function' ...but it works otherwise for recording "sound-was-trapped-birdsound" quite nice!     

---here see all birds of this 3 1/2 days lasting session:    <http://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%22uhl%22+loc%3A%22Siebentischwald%2C+Augsburg%2C+Bavarian+Swabia%2C+Bavaria%22+rmk%3A%22bukWEnort-hab5%22+>

Editing: High-pass filter, cutoff frequency 1kHz, some amplification.

Equipment: Olympus WS-822 digital recorder with Wildtronics Mono amplified parabolic microphone.

recordings.loc: Augsburg, Siebentischwald, east of past Behringer Hof
recordings.rmk:
in mixed forest with  low trees and bushes -- sound was trapped (all birds seen:NO!!) ...habi:'TANNE1-GePu1-REWE'    

 ----- i tryed to record sound of moult-time in the wood ...i fastened for that 4 days my recorder at a low young tree.

> when i was at this place at 22.07.17 morning... nearly the only birds i heard, were juv. Phylloscopus collybita with their adults - and there was strong calm of birds in the forest.

-- ....but when my recorder was alone in this habitat we hear quiet a lot of birds --and when in this seldom entered place... were people these days... the birds stopped singing and calling immediately for 1 hour and longer!

....>>> generally noted to moult: "The birds stop singing. Most birds already did, or sing infrequent. ---- Mating, nesting, breeding, feeding, caring. Exhausted. --- Renew worn plumage. --- Moult, fattening up for migration or the coming winter. ----- No need, no energy, no time to sing.

Apart from silence, the only new sounds this time of year are those of juveniles and of some birds already returning from up north".

Young bird probably not completely weaned yet, calling from a poplar near the riverbank.
Young bird probably not completely weaned yet, calling from a poplar near the riverbank.

Still having diffuculties telling the laughter calls of Green and Black woodpecker apart (Picus viridis/Dryocopus martiu). Is it Green woodpecker followed by Black woodpecker or is it Black woodpecker followed by Black woodpecker? Note that the two birds are heard simultanously at 01:06, so it's definitely two different individuals.

recordings.type: alarm call, life stage uncertain, sex uncertain
recordings.rmk:
**at a little heath with trees and bushes**  ...recorded with a cheap chinese audio-spystick, that was fastened there, at a chain-link fence of a afforest area, ....20 cm above ground     ... "...so at this place **are quite loud to hear various grasshoppers** : ...mainly e.g.:  upland green grasshopper [Tettigonia cantans]    -- & : meadow grasshopper [Pseudochorthippus parallelus, syn.: Chorthippus parallelus]  
  

 .. **-sound was trapped-  .. for 3 days  --Wednesday 18.-Saturday 21.07.2018 --**

place: (( KUSApoleWOIDsanktuAT037 )) .  -....(( SANKTU-Hege!! ))

date/time  **now:  >   ... starts at Thursday 19.07.2018 --- 12,40 o 'clock ...till Thursday 19.07.2018 -- 18,40 p.m MEZ** 

**the analyze of these birds, so isn't shure...cause all NOT SEEN !**

**here:**   now time:  **afternoon**

 .. species: perhaps to 2 the grasshoppers said above additive: 'great green bush cricket [Tettigonia viridissima]', too.


background noise can be some times: traffic noise & plane & rodent & rattl of the fence .

... [all birds of this timer-session  ---heath 07.2018---  see here](https://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%20uhl%20loc%3A%20bobingen%20year%3A%202018%20rmk%3A%20KUSApoleWOIDsanktuAT037) .

... hearing the sound:  **regulate volume carefully**

....  [... plus my former recordings at this place - heath -are here](https://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%20uhl%20loc%3A%20bobingen%20rmk%3A%20SANKTU-Hege) .

recordings.loc: Neuenheimer Feld, Rhein-Neckar-Kreis (near  Heidelberg), Karlsruhe, Baden-Württemberg

recordings.rmk:
Alarm call in presence of a cat.

Same location as XC395460. It seems that Frank Holzapfel was right, discussed [here](https://www.xeno-canto.org/forum/topic/21332).

The alarm call in this recording and on XC395460 are different. Maybe green woodpeckers have different alarm calls for goshawks and for cats? Predator-specific calls are known for certain birds, but I am not aware that this is known for green woodpeckers.

recordings.loc: Augsburg, Siebentischwald, east of past Behringer Hof
recordings.rmk:
...here i tryed to document **"the earliest morning birds" of a 4 days lasting timersession (22.-25.07.2017)**...when you are interressted in it, please see here: 

<https://www.xeno-canto.org/set/3696>

recorded in mixed forest -- **sound was trapped! ..NO!! Bird SEEN!!!** ...habi:  tnö1-rew-NIGHTS

**here now:**  at light rain ...**typical call**
This record is a cut from a permantly recording of four hours in the park-Wood of Gumpenstein. Picus viridis I see often  in this area.

in mixed forest - **sound was trapped [NO!! bird seen!]** for 3 1/2 days (07.11.-10.11.2017) ...24 hours each day. ...habi:'bukWEnort-hab5'  ....i recorded with the Chinese " voice-recorder 'd 50' "; sorry, it has no 'zoom-function' ...but it works otherwise for recording "sound-was-trapped-birdsound" quite nice! 

---here see all birds of this 3 1/2 days lasting session:    <http://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%22uhl%22+loc%3A%22Siebentischwald%2C+Augsburg%2C+Bavarian+Swabia%2C+Bavaria%22+rmk%3A%22bukWEnort-hab5%22+>

recordings.loc: Augsburg, Siebentischwald, east of past Behringer Hof
recordings.rmk:
in mixed forest -- sound was trapped [NO bird seen!!] ..habi:'TANE.a-TÜ-REWE' ---- this is a 4 days lasting try ..(of all 6 different sessions in moult 2017 complete) .... to record BIRDS IN MOULT. -...i fastened my recorder on a little tree, in a seldom of humans entered place in mixed forest -- ...sorry for the 'not so nice' acustis-noise-polution: this is a waterfall of river Lech -- ( ...and cars and train of some km's away routs).

....ALL birds of my ""6-timer-regime-works-OF-MOULT-2017"" ....see here:    <http://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%22uhl%22+rmk%3A%22REWE%22&pg=3>

this now session here, the recorder fastened, between 13.-16.08.2017... beneath a waterhole in mixed forest , is  <http://www.xeno-canto.org/explore?query=rec%3A%22uhl%22+rmk%3A%22TANE.a-T%C3%9C-REWE%22&pg=2>

when you are interrested more in my try "MOULT 2017 in augsburger stadtwald", see here of 'clickable links OF ALL 6 made   session-HABITATS' .  <http://www.xeno-canto.org/set/3311>

...perhaps you enjoy these 6 "moult-sessions 2017 -augsburger stadtwald"

recordings.loc: Augsburg, Siebentischwald, east of past Behringer Hof
recordings.rmk:
"perhaps short by 'flight'?"  --  in mixed forest with  low trees and bushes -- sound was trapped (all birds seen:NO!!) ...habi:'TANNE1-GePu1-REWE'    ----

 ----- i tryed to record sound of moult-time in the wood ...i fastened for that 4 days my recorder at a low young tree.

> when i was at this place at 22.07.17 morning... nearly the only birds i heard, were juv. Phylloscopus collybita with their adults - and there was strong calm of birds in the forest.

-- ....but when my recorder was alone in this habitat we hear quiet a lot of birds --and when in this seldom entered place... were people these days... the birds stopped singing and calling immediately for 1 hour and longer!

....>>> generally noted to moult: "The birds stop singing. Most birds already did, or sing infrequent. ---- Mating, nesting, breeding, feeding, caring. Exhausted. --- Renew worn plumage. --- Moult, fattening up for migration or the coming winter. ----- No need, no energy, no time to sing.

Apart from silence, the only new sounds this time of year are those of juveniles and of some birds already returning from up north".
in mixed forest -- sound was trapped -habi-{cree}

recordings.loc: Novi Sad (near  Kać), Južnobački okrug, Vojvodina
recordings.rmk:
The recording is not modified. The habitat is a 25 year old Populus sp. forest, with some Salix alba.
When i used a playback,he/she came close to me clinging on a tree about 6-7meters from me. Did not had the time to determine the sex. The recording distance is from about a 50meters.
It was a sunny afternoon,with some clouds and some wind.
Singing for a while, but this is the only strophe I could record. Field copse close to fruit orchard and deciduous forest. Afternoon.
